Reviews.Title: “No frills, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Oliver_Liddard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Travelodge London Barking for one night whilst attending a trade expo in Greenwich. The hotel is situated at the end of the Hammersmith & City Line and is a two minute walk from the station. Great town centre location, directly above a Tesco Express and close to pubs and restaurants. I paid £19 for the room online. Check-In was smooth, the room was clean and met my expectations for the price paid. The room felt a bit tired, there were stains on the walls and carpets. Included in the room were Tea & Coffee facilities, digital TV, plenty of towels and a good power shower/bath tub. The hotel felt secure as there was CCTV and a secure entry system at night. My only criticism was there was a distinct lack of staff presence, it could be a while to get the attention of someone. Vending machines were also out of order which was frustrating in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “London Weekend Visit”
Reviews.Author: traveller2008967
Reviews.Content: Visited my daughter in London in early February and decided to stay at Travelodge Barking which was on offer at a very good rate. The hotel is at the terminus of the tube line,Hammersmith and City and also on the District line so Transport links are very good. It is in a very good position some 5 mins from the station and round the corner from the Police Office with shops and services very close. We had to move rooms during our stay due to leaking toilet bowl but they gave another room nearby. The rooms are clean but tired looking with holes in bedding and stained carpets and over the weekend, we noticed that the common areas like stairways were not properly cleaned if at all. Reasonable base for visiting London if got at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Suspicious negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: fargone2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Saturday night and I paid a very cheap price for a hotel room which is within 30 mins train from central London. Barking train station is a mere 5-10 mins walk so don't believe that review where it took them 2 hours to find the hotel. That is simply nonsense. Barking station offers trains which take you direct into Liverpool Street, and also the district and Hammersmith and City lines, if I am not mistaken. The town cenre is not very pleasant for people not used to East London but I knew what to expect. There were plenty of people around the town centre at night and I did not feel in danger at all. There are many fast food joints around, a big indoor shopping centre. The council has really been improving this area in time for the Olympics. I was lucky and I got a big room. It offered the same things that a typical Travelodge room would. Soap and towels in the bathroom. Tea and coffee, kettle and flat-screen TV which is fixed on the wall facing the bed - this was the only negative point. The remote control did not work - either the batteries needed replacing or it was a generic controller which was not properly programmed. For me, it was a small issue since I was only staying one night. One thing people need to be aware of - Travelodge do not have a luggage room - a consequence of its pricing model. Another negative review, written by Loren988, simply sounds unbelievable: "Thieves...they stole one gold bracelet ... is very dirty,smels horrible,the sheets smels like urina..if u have luck you will fin toilet paper.the stuff is unfriendly,they will boder you as long you will stay.i travel a lot and stay very much in hotels but none was like this.i will never stay here even if they pay me to sty here.i will go and check a doctor to see if I m healthy after4night at this trash hotel." First, you can not even write correct English. Second, why would you keep something so valuable, like a gold bracelet, in a hotel room? Third, bedsheets are cleaned before a room is given to guests so how can it smell of urine? Fourth, you could ask for toilet paper if there was none. But I honestly do not believe you. Fifth, you say you travel a lot, but I find only 2 Tripadvisor reviews from you and the other one is saying the same thing about Travelodge, Bristol. I will bet you are someone who was fired from Travelodge and is now trying to say bad things about the franchise. And as for the report from sarapinfold, why did you not ask for another room if it was as bad as you described? If it was really as bad as you say it was, the hotel would have given you another room. The description you gave simply sounds too outrageous to be true.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Loren988
Reviews.Content: Thieves...they stole one gold bracelet..the parking is12.50 pounds per night,clean????dont think about it..is very dirty,smels horrible,the sheets smels like urina..if u have luck you will fin toilet paper.the stuff is unfriendly,they will boder you as long you will stay.i travel a lot and stay very much in hotels but none was like this.i will never stay here even if they pay me to sty here.i will go and check a doctor to see if I m healthy after4night at this trash hotel.please please please do it for you and dont stay here.thx

Reviews.Title: “not great for central london”
Reviews.Author: therasaHull
Reviews.Content: Close to Barking underground and railway, but quite difficult to find as it is set back from the road, behind a Tesco Express, the entrance is in a secluded corner. Not nice to try and find at night with gangs of kids in the communal courtyard area. The hotel is a typical Travelodge, very basic and sparse, so don't expect any more from this. However, it could have been cleaner, it wasn't one of the cleanest I have been to. AND I had to make the bed on arrival as the quilt was haning out of the quilt cover and slung on the bed. If it is London you want you are better off paying the difference and staying more central. I wouldn't choose to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Seems to be a typical London area Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: MikeWReading
Reviews.Content: I nearly abandoned my reservation here having read so many dreadful reviews, but I would have wasted the Â£10 I got the room for when I booked it three months ago in the Travelodge 'sale' so decided to come anyway. In fact it turned out to be no worse than the other London area Travelodges I have stayed in. At least for once I didn't have to go to reception to ask for the extra towels and bedding you would expect if you booked a family room. OK, the shower curtain and bathroom pedal bin lid are missing - but I have never had a generous two bars of soap in a Travelodge before. Also, the windows seem to have good sound insulation, but there is no A/C so it must get very hot sometimes if you keep the windows closed (and it is in a typically Travelodge noisy location). Tesco Express is just round the corner so although the hotel itself doesn't have any catering facility, you can easily pop out for a snack until late at night. Barking train station is around 5 minutes walk; c2c trains have a good reputation for punctuality but my experiences with them were not good and if I ever come here again I'll probably try the Underground although it's a lot of stops from central London. All in all, if you can get a room for the Â£19 they keep advertising, it's OK - the problem with Travelodge is that it pretends to compete with the likes of Holiday Inn Express and Premier Inn - it's like comparing Ryanair to British Airways and Emirates. My biggest gripe with Travelodge in general is the way the fairly small screen TV is fixed high up on the wall so you can only see it from the bed, and their idea of a comfy chair in the newer outlets is hard plastic. There is nowhere to put your things by the bed - just a small hole in the headboard that can hardly fit a travel alarm clock let along anything else. The range of TV and Radio channels is inexplicably very limited. If you need anything or if something is wrong with the room you have to go all the way back to reception to ask for it, and even then the shortage of staff often means nothing is done about it. You certainly wouldn't want to be in a Travelodge room a minute longer than you have to. Remember to bring your own shampoo!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt bother”
Reviews.Author: SHeer121
Reviews.Content: Booked a family room. The beds were really uncomfortable, rooms are extremely basic and expensive for what you actually get, which isnt much! Sofa beds are grubby and you have to put the sheets on yourself, not enough linen and towels to accomodate a family.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else - this is just four walls a toilet and a bed”
Reviews.Author: Opiemagnum
Reviews.Content: No phones in rooms, no breakfast area, no minibar or safes, no free wifi, no AC - they don't even offer shampoo or bodywash. This is more like a hostel with private rooms than a hotel. On the plus side it is reasonably clean and a 3 minute walk from a tube station although it's a 40 minute ride to central London.

Reviews.Title: “In one word: Awful”
Reviews.Author: Yerevan75
Reviews.Content: The only two good things i can say about this hotel is that it is a 5 minute walk from Barking station (you can get to the centre of London in around 40 minutes) and the girl at reception (I don't know her name but she is an Asian Briton) was very kind and professional. The hotel itself is recently built but you would never guess! The insulation is non existent (noise coming from everywhere), the mattress was the most uncomfortable I ever slept on in a London hotel (soft and makes you slide into the middle), there was no towel and when i asked for one it smelt of dust so i prefered not to use it. The room is ugly, the lighting in the room is poor - Awful

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT COME BY CAR”
Reviews.Author: hansardtony
Reviews.Content: I'm the sort of person who when seeing negative reviews, always thinks "it can't be that bad" - If you come by car it is.The hotel is bog standard Travellodge - you need to ask for extra towels, pillows etc. In fairness the rooms were clean,check in speedy (although if you want to check in before 2.30 the computer says NO unless you pay an additional Â£10).The underground is 5 mins away and there are numerous takeaways and shops locally.Now for the bad news. the nearest car park is on Axe Street. Over 6 hours parking per day is Â£12 in coins- however the car park is free overnight and charging recommces at 7am. Therefore you need to be up with the larks either to leave or feed more Â£1 coins into the machine. An alternative which we took is to leave in shopping centre car park - cost Â£38 for 24 hours!!!!! but at least you can have a lie in. If you decide to this you must book in at the car park office. Unregistered cars attract a Â£60 fine!The parking was way dearer that the hotel! If you decide to stay here Use public transport - Do Not Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, poor service”
Reviews.Author: KennethTan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the Travelodge Barking. The hotel is a bit of distance away from central London. The hotel is located about 3 minutes or so from Barking station which is served by overground, Hammersmith and City line, and District line trains. The hotel may be difficult to locate on Google Maps and Bing Maps as the area is newly developed. The easiest way to find it would be to look for Barking police station which is located right next door to the hotel. Access to the hotel is from the back of the building next door to the police station. There is a Tesco Express on the ground floor, on the front of the building, on the same side as the police station entrance. The hotel is very poorly maintained. One of the 2 lifts was not working for the whole week that I was staying at the hotel. The stairs are dirty, and it was evident that it was not cleaned nor vacuumed in the entire time when I was there. The one lift which was working was not much cleaner either. I was given room 120 located on the first floor, facing the front of the building (the same side as the front of the police station). The room was quite large. The carpet in the room appear to be dirty even though it was a dark coloured carpet. The bathroom floor was also dirty. The shower appears to be cleaner, but the shower screen was mouldy. The mattress felt quite worn. The TV worked fine, though the remote control would not work from time to time. The room was very poorly insulated and sound proofed, making it very noisy to the point where one can clearly hear conversations and footsteps of people walking pass downstairs. The hotel purportedly tries to keep costs low, not providing much amenities. However, the cleaner left all the lights in the room on every day! The key card would randomly fail to work. The hotel's computer system had record of me staying for the whole week, so there is no reason for the hotel resetting my key card. The staff claims that they automatically reset the key cards every 24 hours. However, there were days when the key card worked over a period of more than 24 hours, thus refuting his claim. There are few places for food in the evening. There is a Japanese restaurant in the courtyard outside the hotel. The food there was OK, but nothing special whether in terms of quality nor price.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Gill6639
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several Travelodge's before, i was shocked just how down market they have become. This receptionists at the hotel had great difficulty understanding even the most basic english, the rooms are dirty and the bedding had stains all over it. The sheets only covered about 3/4 of the bed. I travelled with a small school party who were competing at the ExCel centre. On the morning of the competition, the lock on the room that held our competition stuff broke which meant we were unable to get into the room. This was eventually sorted out after some considerable delay which made us late for the competition. That same evening, the lock again stuck on the door meaning that we coud not get into the room for a further 90 minutes, again making us late for an evening reception we were expected to attend. After some argument, they did agree to change the rooms but that did not make up for our lateness to both the competition and the evening reception. We asked to speak to a Manager but we were told one was not available - anywhere. The vending machine in reception was also broken. I woud not use this hotel again. I know Travelodge are a budget hotel, however, Travelodge Barking takes budget to a whole new level. I have stayed in cleaner, better hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable , basic clean room.”
Reviews.Author: stiltskin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst working at the Boat show. It was a basic good clean room, with a shower and toilet, and working TV. For customers familiar with Travelodge it was a typical room. The hotel was only 5 miles from the Excel exhibiton centre, this took beteen 5 and ten minutes in the car. As this area is Newly built your Sat-Nav might not recognise the Post code, so you phone reception and ask for directions and are told to set it to Clockhouse Avenue, It would have been helpful if this information was on the website. there is no parking at the hotel, but there is a nearby carpark, 1 minute walk away, and after 7pm, you can insert money for parking the folling morning, as charges apply from 7am, and there were 3 keen traffic wardens roaming the carpark in the morning. The building is set on the edge of a newly built Plaza. There was a very good Sushi restaurant right oppostite serving really fresh food in a calming atmosphere. Other than that there are lots of take away burger and kebab shops in the high street which is very close. A tesco Express was literally just a few doors away, so very handy for stocking up on reading materals and snacks. There is an Asda in the shopping Centre a few minutes walk away and also a Liddle supermarket in easy walking distance. My only grumble is at 5am, there was some ubnbelevable loud boise outside, perhaps a rubbish truck or building work ?, so we remembered to use our earplugs that night. It is close to a busy area, and I supose you could say Barking High Street is a little bit run down.

Reviews.Title: “Good base, good value.”
Reviews.Author: LukeMMA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights whilst in London to attend the UFC expo at Earls Court, and the UFC 120 show at the o2 arena. We arrived at Barking Station after a 35 minute journey from Victoria. The hotel is close distance to the station (about 3 mins). On the bottom of the building is a Tesco Express for snacks cheaper than the vending machines in the hotel. Over the road is an Asda store (situated in the shopping centre) which is even cheaper. The room was a standard size but had no bath. A decent sized TV, tea, coffee and the normal stuff. The room only had 1 large towel but the staff quickly got me another at my request. Overall it was a decent base for the weekends activities, although the cost of tube tickets will add up if you are staying a few days. The price of the hotel overall for 4 nights was Â£129 as i booked each day individually at the sale rates (otherwise it would have been Â£260ish). As usual with travelodge, there is no smoking rooms. If you are a smoker there is a well lit bench in the centre of the hotel and the surrounding buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Gordieborn2
Reviews.Content: Very dirty rooms Bed sheets not changed from when the last person stayed. Bed was just remade. Numerous body hair found in the bed shower and sink. Skid marks left in the toilet. This was the better room of the two that we were offered Complaint sent to travelodge but I doubt we will hear anything

Reviews.Title: “Utterly horrible with bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: lisa186408
Reviews.Content: We turned up a little early, we was told we couldnâ€™t leave our luggage there and have to turn up later at 3 to check in. We turned up again at about 5:00 there was no one at the reception we called the bell several times. After 10 minutes of wait somebody turned up. We asked if they had a lobby he turned around and said no what do u expect for the price you have paid, I was gobsmacked. We went up to our rooms the door was so stiff had to push it open and did not close properly, there was no long mirror this was broken, the couch had stains all over it and there were stains on the floor also. I would not recommend this hotel my stay there was ruined and couldnâ€™t wait 2 get out of there, and also the staff were very rude they came up at 11:00 to make sure we were leaving at 12:00 when there was a do not disturb sign outside.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Anette71
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Germany on 16.October 2010 at 22.00 pm with our two little kids (3 and 6 years old) and wanted to check in our reserved and confirmed rooms. The receptionist said that there is no room for us. It was late, our kids were tired and we would not know how to find another hotel at this late time. No help, nothing that the receptionist would do for us. I can`t understand why this could happened. We booked our room, got a reservation confirm and than is no room available???

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Tamazaki
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Travelodge Barking for 2 nights recently. Check in was a little slow, but the rooms were big enough, and clean enough. The wireless internet didn't work - although a new Japanese restaurant has opened next door, and when we went there for dinner, they had free wireless internet (and a power socket!). The hotel was a good nights sleep, and would use again. It's worth to try the Japanese restaurant next door though, very tasty food!

Reviews.Title: “could not recommend even if you get a cheap rate”
Reviews.Author: kcchiu888
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in early october to meet a client in central London. I booked this room sometime ago and got a double for Â£9 during that sale. Check in was easy and quick and the room was large and clean and everything in the room worked. The room only had a shower which was clean and had lots of very hot water. The trouble with this hotel as mentioned by many others before is that there is no free or reasonable parking anywhere near the hotel. It was Â£12.50 for over 7 hours parking in a nearby car park as all the streets within a reasonable walk to the hotel were all residents permit only.. The station is less then 5mins from the hotel and there is a Tesco express open till 11pm to the back of the same block as the hotel. Macdonald, KFC, Dominos, Nandos and other eateries are all within a short walk. Although for the price i paid it was a reasonable stay but i would pay a lot more to stay nearer central London as Barking is still a long tube ride into town and you will waste a lot of time with the travelling. And i think just on a general note i would rather not go back to Barking.On this occassion (the day after a 24hr strike) it took me 2 hours to get to Earls Court and coming back was even worse 3hours 15mins before i got back to Barking .

Reviews.Title: “OMFG !”
Reviews.Author: Wulfie
Reviews.Content: What a place ! Don't think you can drive to this hotel, hard to get parking as there is none on site, dreadful customer service, the guy on the reception carried on with an SMS, when he was checking us in. Room was small, smokey smelling and the TV had no remote. NEVER EVER again, i would rather sleep in my CAR !

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel if your driving!”
Reviews.Author: michelle20Preston
Reviews.Content: It was a long drive from Preston to london, so taking this into account when we got to the hotel the last thing we wanted was to look for parking because my partner and I were both tired. We struggled to find overnight parking as the hotel did not provide any. We went to reception and asked and they offered little help. We went away and looked again, having no luck we went to the reception again and only then they decided to show us a map of were they recommended to park our car. The car park was not secure or cheap. We returned to reception and there was no one on the desk or in the office. We rung the bell and even phoned them but no answer to either. We waited 28minutes untill the lady came to reception. In this time two coustomers had walked away. Because of this delay in finding parking and waiting for a receptionist we had missed our early check in despite arriving at 12:30am. Once in our room i noticed it was very clean. Even the kettle was free from lime scale which was impressive so if you can overlook the bad service then this hotel is okay. The halls were cluttered with laundry trollys however for two days which looked untidy. This hotel is in the centre of the town and 30minutes away from london or right next to the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: cle023
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay, no complaints except that the flats opposite were a bit noisy as a party was going on. Great to use as a base and great value for money.Beds soo comfortable. Rooms cleaned to high standard

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: getmetotheairport
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel room in London so I could travel out early on a flight from London City Airport. The airport is only 15-20 minutes maximum on the Tube/DLR from the hotel, so worth it if anyone was considering that. The hotel itself was obviously quite new. It had the new style Travelodge rooms which were fresh, modern and functional. Everything was clean and very presentable. Located a convenient short distance from the station, under a five minute walk. The staff member on the desk was not entirely polite, but it wasn't an issue.. I didn't have to interact with her again. Decent Tesco Metro below.. able to buy croissants, etc for breakfast. Also opposite a mall shopping area which contained a larger Asda. Slightly rough area, but not a massive problem.

Reviews.Title: “Price Vs Location??? The Big Question!”
Reviews.Author: NicolaNicolaNicola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tavelodge Barking while in London to visit the O2. We won tickets to a gig in the arena less than a week before the event and as we live in Liverpool we wanted somewhere CHEAP to stay while we were in London. Everything we found in Central London/Excel seemed to be out of our price range and so we started to look slightly further away. We came across the Travelodge online and at Â£47.50 a night it was less than half the price of our next best option so we decided to give it a go. We arrived into Euston and from there we took the Northern Line to Moorgate then the Hammersmith and City Line straight to Barking Station. The Journey took about 30 minutes and was very simple. The Travelodge is about a 5 minute walk from Barking Station. Simply walk out of the station, turn right, walk down the shopping street until you reach McDonalds, then look to the left and you will see the hotel entrance. For the O2 we took either the Hammersmith and City Line or the District Line to West Ham then took the Jubilee Line to Greenwich North. The Journey took about 20 minutes and was so easy. I would say it was much quicker than travelling from Central London and because of the direction MUCH less busy when leaving the arena in crowds of people. Barking itself is quite a busy area. Immediatly outside the hotel is a busy shopping area with shops, banks and restaurants. The area seems very multi cultural and there is something for everyone. It is a little scruffy and perhaps not the type of place you would want to spend a weeks holiday but if you simply want a cheap base with great transport links then it's fine for a night or 2. We returned from the O2 around Midnight and the Barking streets at night were a little intimidating. Travelling with my partner I felt quite safe but I am not sure I would have returned so late if I was alone or with a girlfriend. (but the same could be said of any city I do not know that well) The Travelodge itself was a standard Travelodge like the rest (but obviously brand new). Very clean, spacious room, small flat screen TV, good power shower. My only complaint about the room is that the window didn't open very far and the weather was so hot during our stay. All in all we were happy with our stay and for the price we cannot complain!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for the price”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller186220
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night to take advantage of a 21GBP per night rate. Modern and clean hotel with standard travelodge design rooms. No problems checking in despite pre-paying for the room. Very convenient to shops and places to eat. 30 minutes by tube from Central London and 5 minute walk to tube station. Yes Barking is not the most salubrious part of London but if Travelodge are offering a good price for the rooms here, definetely a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean and very good base for central London”
Reviews.Author: fanfun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barking Travelodge for a few days whilst taking in a show and doing the usual "tourist things" in central London. We found this Travelodge to be clean with large rooms and friendly staff. The Station is only five minutes from the hotel and as others have said it takes about 25 minutes to get to central London. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit central London on a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Staggeringly unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldJazzfan
Reviews.Content: Whilst acknowledging that the rooms here are of a good standard for the price and the fact that this is a noisy and run diwn area is not the fault of Travelodge the standard of service provided by the rude ,obstructive and disinterested staff was the lowest possible. I and a colleague arrived at 6.00 pm to stay overnight for a meeeting the following morning. The desk staff refused to allow us to go to our rooms because we could not provide a "home address".which was difficult as the rooms had been booked and paid for in advance by our employer. After initially offering to contact the manager the reception clerk claimed that he was not available saying that their was nothing he could do ,we couldn't have the rooms and that it was "not his problem". I assured the man that I was willing to make it his problem by arguing all night if needed and after 40 minutes of this in which we were repeatedly told that it was "not his problem" he made a simple call which confirmed that we had a valid booking and that the rooms were paid for.During this call the receptioist checked the spelling of my name on his computor screen wher it has obviously been displayed throughout.. By the time that this member of staff was willing to check us in my colleague and I were too late to catch a tube to central London to make use of the Â£70 worth of theatre tickets which we had also bought in advance. Needles to say I will do my best to ensure that my employer (a large Local Authority does not make use of ANY Travelodge again).

Reviews.Title: “Typical new build Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Lincolnshirechap
Reviews.Content: Built in the revamped area around Barking Town Hall, no car park. Barking isn't the richest or smartest region of London, but we only saw happy and smiling faces where ever we went, day and night. Usual front desk for Travelodge, helpful, swift and no fuss. Two lifts, clean corridors, our room (221) was long and wedge shaped, bed was fine, as was the shower and toilet. You don't go to these sort of hotels to spend any time in the rooms, but there was a flat screen TV and a couple of prints on the walls, mirrors and tea/coffee/kettle stuff. Booked early Â£39.00 for two, no breakfast., ideal for our needs on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for seeing London on the cheap.”
Reviews.Author: GarthDanlor
Reviews.Content: We've been to London many times before and this time around we were simply looking for a cheap and clean place to stay that still had good transport links to Central London, and the Barking Travelodge fit the bill nicely. We stayed for a week at a ridiculously low rate (just under Â£100 total!!). The hotel itself is very new and our room was large, clean and in very good condition. Being Travelodge the room very basic, but it did include a nice LCD TV and a coffee/tea maker. We did have to ask staff everyday to give us a second set of towels, but that is a relatively minor issue considering the huge cost savings. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the train station, and is only a few steps off of the pedestrianized main street. There are plenty of places to shop, eat, and drink close to the hotel and there was a street market multiple times over the week. Don't think I saw/heard another tourist the whole time we were in that area...quite nice really. Barking station is served by two Underground lines, but the fastest and most comfortable way of going into Central London seemed to be via the C2C trains to Fenchurch (about 13-15 minutes), and then getting on the Underground at Tower Hill. Load a zone 1-4 travelcard onto your Oyster Card and it will cover all of the options. I'd have no problems staying at this hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge London Barking
HotelInfo.Address: Ripple Road | Barking, London IG11 9PN, England
